0.cdata!: Colombia - Tercer Proyecto De Credito Agropecuario

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Third Agricultural
            Credit Project in Colombia are as follows: overall outcome
            of the project was satisfactory, and the performance of the
            Bank and the Borrower were also satisfactory. Some of the
            lessons learned from the project are: a) procurement of
            goods and services has caused many delays in the past. The
            standardization of bidding documents and procedures for
            Bank-assisted projects in Colombia should accelerate the
            procurement process in the future; b) as in almost all
            Bank-assisted projects in Colombia, presentation to the Bank
            of audited financial statements was always delayed by more
            than eight months. The Bank must take strong action from the
            beginning to ensure proper compliance with this condition of
            the Loan Agreement; c) although the project had a good
            Project Coordinator; he did not have a high rank within the
            institution. Many issues could have been resolved early on
            if the Project Coordinator had worked full-time on the
            project and had had direct access to the General Manager;
            and d) provision of technical assistance to project
            beneficiaries proved to be expensive, mainly because it was
            oriented to individual farmers rather than to groups of
            farmers, but also because there was no link between
            Instituto Colombiano de la Reforma Agraria (INCORA's)
            extension service and Instituto Colombiano Agropecuario
            (ICA's) service.
